intro: Psychotria cartagoensis, commonly known as the Cartago psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Psychotria cartagoensis is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its ecological significance in supporting local biodiversity.
